member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the target type. Only data of that type is bound by this binder.
member.value: The name of the target type.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.NodeBinder.ValuePath
member.summary: Gets or sets the value path. It is the name of the property which is bound to the value of the treemap item.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.NodeBinder.TextPath
member.summary: Gets or sets the text path. It is the name of the property which is bound to the text of the treemap item.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.NodeBinder.ItemsSourcePath
member.summary: Gets or sets the items source path. It is the name of the property which is used as items source for the children of the treemap item.

member.summary: Gets or sets the ToolTipMemberPath property.

member.summary: Gets or sets the ToolTipContentTemplate property.

member.summary: Gets or sets the node style. It overrides the style applied to the bound node.

member.summary: The node is deeper in the data hierarchy than the showing depth

member.summary: Provides the behavior for the Measure pass of Silverlight layout. Classes can override this method to define their own Measure pass behavior.

member.returns: The actual size used once the element is arranged.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.LayoutType
member.summary: The types of layout algorithm

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.LayoutType.SliceAndDice
member.summary: SliceAndDice – this algorithm aims to preserve the initial order at the expense of the aspect ratio.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.LayoutType.Squarified
member.summary: Squarified – this algorithm obtains the best aspect ratio but the objects are arranged by size.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.LayoutType.Strip
member.summary: Strip – this tiling algorithm has a better aspect ratio than the SliceAndDice and keeps a better order than Squarified.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.SliceAndDice
member.summary: Arranges the treemap using the slice and dice layout algorithm

member.name: T:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.Squarified
member.summary: Arranges the treemap using the squarified layout algorithm

member.summary: Calculates the worsts the ratio in a group of items.

member.summary: Adds the items to the treemap.

member.summary: Adds the row.

member.summary: Adds the column.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.ValueMapper.TargetName
member.summary: If you have a custom template for the xamTreemap control’s nodes and you have a named element, you can use TargetName to specify this element.

member.summary: The name of the property of the tree map item the value of which will be mapped to some data.

member.summary: Value type name determines the name of the type which has the field containing data specified by ValuePath.

member.summary: The path to the property of the data which determines its value.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.GroupValueMapper.GroupValues
member.summary: Gets or sets the group values. GroupValues is a collection of values which the similar objects gain.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.GroupValueMapper.Order
member.summary: If Ascending, the first group value is assigned to the smallest element. If Descending the first group value is assigned to the biggest element.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.MappingInfo
member.summary: This is a class that contains the needed info when a mapping is set so that afterwards it can be reset to its initial value.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.MappingInfo.Mapper
member.summary: The mapped by which the mapping is set. When resetting sometimes is needed to reset only the mappings of a certain mapper.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.MappingMode
member.summary: Determines whether the leaves or all nodes will be mapped.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.MappingMode.LeafNodesOnly
member.summary: Leaf nodes only are mapped.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.MappingMode.AllNodes
member.summary: All nodes are mapped.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.NodeDistance
member.summary: The distance between tho nodes is the abs of the difference between them.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.ColorMapper
member.summary: The ColorMapper adds color to the nodes of the xamTreemap depending on a specified value. It maps some property of the data to a property of the node – for example the fill color or foreground color. From and To – these two properties determine the range in which the color is determined depending on the value of each node.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.RangeMapper
member.summary: Value mapper that maps to values in the range between DataMinimum and DataMaximum

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Identifies the Minimum dependency property

member.summary: Raises the event.

member.summary: Identifies the Maximun dependency property

member.summary: Raises the event.
member.param: The instance containing the event data.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.RangeMapper.GetRelativeValue(System.Double)
member.summary: Gets the relative value.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.RangeMapper.GetRelativeValue(Infragistics.Controls.Charts.TreemapNodeInfo)
member.summary: Gets the relative value. This is a value between 0 and 1 which determines how close the value is to the DataMinimum and DataMaximum.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.RangeMapper.UpdateDataRange(System.Double)
member.summary: Updates the data range.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.RangeMapper.DataMinimum
member.summary: Gets or sets the data minimum. If the value specified by ValuePath is less than DataMinimum for a certain node then the mapper applies the value of the From property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.RangeMapper.DataMaximum
member.summary: Gets or sets the data maximum. If the value specified by ValuePath is more than DataMaximum for a certain node then the mapper applies the value of the To property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.RangeMapper.ActualDataMinimum
member.summary: Gets or sets the actual data minimum. This is the lowest value among all mapped items.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.RangeMapper.ActualDataMaximum
member.summary: Gets or sets the actual data maximum. This is the highest value among all mapped items.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.DoubleMapper
member.summary: The DoubleMapper sets a numeric value to the nodes’ template of the xamTreemap depending on a specified property from the nodes’ data context. From and To – these two properties determine the range of the value which will be applied to the node’s template.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.RadialColorMapper
member.summary: The RadialColorMapper adds color with a radial gradient brush to the nodes of the xamTreemap depending on a specified value. It maps some property of the data to a property of the node – for example the fill color or foreground color. From and To – these two properties determine the range in which the color is determined depending on the value of each node.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.XamTreemap
member.summary: The Treemap control. Treemaps display hierarchical (tree-structured) data as a set of nested nodes. Each branch of the tree is given a treemap node, which is then tiled with smaller nodes representing sub-branches. Each node's rectangle has an area proportional to a specified dimension on the data. Often the nodes are colored to show a separate dimension of the data.

member.summary: Method overridden to provide a default height and width.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.XamTreemap.RegisterResources(System.String,System.Reflection.Assembly)
member.summary: Adds an additonal Resx file in which the control will pull its resources from.
member.param: The name of the embedded resx file that contains the resources to be used.
The assembly in which the resx file is embedded.
member.remarks: Don't include the extension of the file, but prefix it with the default Namespace of the assembly.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.XamTreemap.UnregisterResources(System.String)
member.summary: Removes a previously registered resx file.
member.param: The name of the embedded resx file that was used for registration.
member.remarks: Note: this won't have any effect on controls that are already in view and are already displaying strings. It will only affect any new controls created.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.XamTreemap.NodeBinders
member.summary: Gets or sets the node binders. This is the collection of all the binders that the treemap uses.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.XamTreemap.ValueMappers
member.summary: Gets or sets the value mappers. This is the collection of all the mappers that the treemap uses.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.XamTreemap.LayoutType
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of the layout. It determines the layout algorithm of the treemap.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.XamTreemap.LayoutOrientation
member.summary: Gets or sets the layout direction.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.XamTreemap.ShowingDepth
member.summary: This is the depth of the last level to show.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.XamTreemap.ItemMinSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the item min. The ItemMinSize property allows the user to set the minimum size of the nodes. If a nodeâ€™s width or height is smaller than the ItemMinSize, then the node is rendered as a writeable bitmap image.
member.value: The size of the item min.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.XamTreemap.ItemsSource
member.summary: Gets or sets the items source. It is an enumerable which represents the hierarchical data of the treemap.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.XamTreemap.ItemsSourceRoot
member.summary: This is a subitem of the items source which will be used as a treemap root

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.XamTreemap.DefaultStyle
member.summary: A description of the property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.XamTreemap.ActualShowingDepth
member.summary: Gets or sets the actual showing depth. Actual Showing Depth The xamTreemap controlâ€™s ActualShowingDepth property specifies the maximum hierarchy level that is displayed. In the case when a custom ShowingDepth is set this value is always lower or equal to the ShowingDepth. If you have a hierarchy set as a data source which has only two levels and you set the ShowingDepth property to 5, the ActualShowingDepth property is going to be 2.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.XamTreemap.ToolTipStyle
member.summary: Sets or gets xamTreemap's ToolTipStyle property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.XamTreemap.CustomValueMappers
member.summary: Contains all the custom mappers. If we do not have them when clearing the mappers container we cannot clear their mappings.
